author: thegostep
content:
I am here to support the renaming of the fee variables! 

Proposal:
- rename `base_fee` to `inclusion_fee` (or `inclusion_fee_per_gas`) because it’s the fee you pay for inclusion 
- rename `miner_tip` / `inclusion_fee` to `priority_fee` (or `priority_fee_per_gas`) because it’s the fee you pay to be ahead of everyone else

I bring social proof to support my argument: https://twitter.com/thegostep/status/1382742730628071427?s=20

author: thegostep
content:
At flashbots, we've been working hard to educate miners on eip1559 and MEV - the "inclusion" vs "priority" dichotomy has been very useful in framing the recent drawdown in gas prices and arguing for how it would map to eip1559
source: https://medium.com/flashbots/flashbots-transparency-report-february-2021-8ac45b467d0a

author: thegostep
content: I think this new naming would clear up a lot of confusion in the community!

author: thegostep
content:
A recent research post by Leo + Georgios uses a similar analogy of “high speed” and “low speed” highways
https://www.aniccaresearch.tech/blog/ethereum-blockspace-who-gets-what-and-why

author: thegostep
content:
I know everyone here is probably tired of discussing naming, but names matter! Picking names that intuitively make sense to the most amount of people helps people cooperate most efficiently.

I hope it is not too late to consider the proposal

author: cronoss5638
content: Naming them 'base_fee' and 'priority_fee' implies that you don't have to pay _any_ 'priority_fee' for regular user transactions, which is not true at all.

author: sky.cactus
content: The priority fee serves two purposes, so it is unlikely we'll find something that perfectly fits.

author: sky.cactus
content: During times of no-congestion, priority fee determines position and has a minimum threshold required for inclusion.

author: sky.cactus
content: During times of increasing congestion, priority fee determines who gets in.
